title: Relative Grading
content: How does relative Grading work in PES? Can someone please explain?

comments.body: It's a great mystery. Nobody knows. Your grade just somehow magically goes up and nobody knows how or why. Sit back and enjoy the bigger number on your gradecard, don't go around asking questions or else
Will the min pass marks reduce? (Actually asking for a friend)

Yes it does. I know a guy who checked his esa papers because he got an E grade in math

I looked at the marks and turns out he was supposed to fail. He got less than 40 when you combine everything. Only way he passed was relative grading i suppose

Oh that's good to hear.
Thanks a lot for the reply !

I reviewed my physics paper in sem 2, I had scored 60 out of 100 in esa, I had 37 out of 50 in internals. If we take 60/2 = 30 in end sems, 37/2 = 18.5 , adding the two we get 48.5 (Rounded off to 50) this got me B grade. 

According to the official grading scheme  S is >90, A is 80-90 , B is 70-80.

Now when batch underperforms, the grading scheme is reduced 

now S will be 70+ , A for 60-70, B for 50-60
That clears things up, thank you!
Nobody actually knows it but somehow i have always got 1 or 2 more grades than i expect in every subject since last 2 sems. ,probably that’s what “relative grading” probably is..
You don't need to divide the internals marks by 2, do you?
Why did you divide 37/2. Shouldn’t your marks me 30+37 = 67/100
Yes , My bad mistake from my side
grade in the sense the sgpa?
Can go both the way,but the grade actually means the ultimate alphabet form of your subject marks,for ex i was expecting C in physics and ended up having A grade
